intro: Crotalaria longiclavata, commonly known as the long-clawed crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmate leaves, which are deeply divided into three to five lobes. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. It produces small, elongated seed pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Crotalaria longiclavata is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
